channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'She's not Black': Janet Jackson on Kamala Harris' racial identity
item.description: In a recent interview, Janet Jackson questioned Kamala Harris's Black heritage, stating she had heard that Harris is Indian. The interviewer clarified that Harris has both Indian and Black heritage. Kamala Harris identifies as Black and made history as the first Black and Asian American woman to serve as Vice President.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'States must refrain ... ': What Quad members said on Ukraine, Gaza & China
item.description: The Quad leaders raised concerns about security in Ukraine and Gaza, condemning the October 7 attacks. They reaffirmed commitment to a two-state solution for Israel-Palestine and called for adherence to international law. The leaders also condemned any threats of nuclear weapon use in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel army claims Hezbollah 'targets civilians', launches strike in retaliation
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces carried out fresh attacks early Sunday on Hezbollah positions in Lebanon after the group launched rockets at northern Israel. The IDF claimed that Hezbollah targeted civilian areas, leading to widespread disruption. This escalation follows an Israeli airstrike in Beirut that killed multiple people, including senior Hezbollah leaders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Marxist leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake leads Sri Lanka's presidential race: Key updates
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake from the National People's Power leads Sri Lanka's presidential election with a significant margin, securing 58% of postal votes. Voter turnout is at nearly 75%, lower than the previous election. Main opposition leader Sajith Premadasa follows with 23%, and incumbent president Ranil Wickremesinghe lags behind with only 16%.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 19 killed in coal mine blast in Iran's Tabas
item.description: A devastating explosion at a coal mine in Tabas, eastern Iran, killed at least 3o people and injured 17 others. The blast happened late Saturday with around 70 workers present. This tragedy underscores ongoing safety concerns in Iran's mining sector, which has faced multiple fatal incidents over the years.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump says 'too late' after Harris accepts another debate proposal
item.description: Donald Trump declined a new debate with Kamala Harris, citing that voting is underway and it’s too late. Harris accepted CNN's proposal for an October 23 debate. Trump's campaign highlighted his participation in two debates compared to Harris' one, suggesting the timing is not appropriate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel strikes Gaza school, killing 22; cites Hamas command center within
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on a former school in northern Gaza resulted in at least 22 deaths, mostly women and children. The Israeli military stated the target was a Hamas command center. This incident is part of ongoing hostilities that have heavily impacted civilian infrastructure and displaced around 90% of Gaza's Palestinian population.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Dan Evans? 2nd person in Washington's history to be elected governor thrice, dies at 98
item.description: Dan Evans, former Republican governor of Washington state and US senator, passed away at age 98. Serving three terms as governor, he was known for his moderate political stance and contributions to environmental legislation. He also played a key role in establishing The Evergreen State College and the state's community college system.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FBI agents boards ship operated by same company linked to Baltimore bridge collapse
item.description: FBI agents boarded the Maersk Saltoro at the Port of Baltimore, managed by Synergy Marine Group, linked to a fatal bridge collapse. This action follows a lawsuit against the Dali's owner for gross negligence. The Maersk Saltoro was preparing to depart for Sri Lanka when inspected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel raids Al Jazeera's West Bank bureau, serves 45 days closure notice
item.description: Israeli forces raided Al Jazeera's office in Ramallah, ordering a 45-day closure without providing reasons. The Palestinian Journalists' Syndicate condemned the action as a violation of media freedom. This follows Israel's earlier revocation of Al Jazeera journalists' press credentials and a ban on the channel's operations within the country.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'China continues to behave aggressively': Biden caught saying in hot mic blunder
item.description: During the Quad summit, US President Joe Biden was overheard via a hot mic discussing China's aggressive behavior and Xi Jinping's domestic focus. Although China wasn't directly mentioned in the joint statement, it highlighted concerns over the East and South China Seas. Efforts to reduce tensions with China were also noted.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Couldn't have been better suited for my last foreign visit as PM': Japan's Fumio Kishida on Quad
item.description: Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida marked his last foreign visit by attending the Quad summit, emphasizing its importance. He addressed growing global security concerns and highlighted the need for a free and open Indo-Pacific. Kishida called for practical cooperation with regional countries to ensure mutual benefits and uphold shared values like freedom and democracy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Anura Kumara Dissanayake to become Sri Lanka President: Early trends
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake, leader of the National People's Power, is set to become Sri Lanka’s ninth executive president based on early postal voting results. Dissanayake has secured 56% of the votes, while his main opponents Sajith Premadasa and current President Ranil Wickremesinghe have each garnered 19%, indicating a likely victory for him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Defining alliance of 21st century': White House on PM Modi, President Biden bilateral ties
item.description: President Biden and Prime Minister Modi affirmed their commitment to the US-India Comprehensive Global and Strategic Partnership, focusing on defense, technology, space, health, and environmental cooperation. They praised India's leadership in the G-20 and humanitarian support for Ukraine. Future collaborations include semiconductor plants, space research with NASA-Isro, and clean energy projects.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: President Biden places hand on PM Modi's shoulder as he answers question on Quad survival
item.description: President Joe Biden reassured the Quad alliance's future beyond US elections during a meeting with PM Modi, Australian PM Albanese, and Japanese PM Kishida. India will host the Quad Summit in 2025. Biden announced new initiatives for maritime technology and coast guard collaboration to enhance security in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Deadly Israeli airstrike in Beirut kills 37
item.description: An Israeli airstrike in a Beirut suburb killed at least 37 people, including senior Hezbollah leaders. The attack targeted an underground meeting of Hezbollah commanders, resulting in significant casualties and damage. This escalation has heightened cross-border violence and diplomatic tensions, prompting Lebanon's Prime Minister to cancel his planned UN visit.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump made Robinson...': Harris' campaign aims to shift voters in NC amid scandal
item.description: Kamala Harris' campaign is seizing the scandal surrounding North Carolina gubernatorial candidate Mark Robinson to win over Black and suburban voters. By focusing on Robinson's controversial remarks and his connection with Trump, Harris' team aims to influence voter sentiment in this key swing state, seeing it as a significant opportunity for the next election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French President Emmanuel Macron appoints new govt in shift to right
Europe needs to be tough on migrants: Danish PM Mette Frederiksen
Zelenskyy hopes for quick US action as more arms depots hit in Russia
